snippet: The state has begun the fight against its newest enemy — prescription-drug abuse — which over the last decade has led to a more than 60 percent increase in drug-overdose deaths.
abstract: New Mexico authorities are grappling with the high overdose death rate, which the state's Health Department says has jumped by 60 percent between 2001 and 2010; public health officials say the spike is being driven primarily by prescription painkillers, whose sales in the state rose 131 percent during the same period.
lead_paragraph: The state has begun the fight against its newest enemy — prescription-drug abuse — which over the last decade has led to a more than 60 percent increase in drug-overdose deaths.

headline.seo: In New Mexico, Battling Prescription Drug Use That Leads to Overdoses
headline.main: Prescription Drug Overdoses Plague New Mexico
headline.print_headline: Where Overdoses Start on the Prescription Pad
